summary: Samuel Mannarino was involved in gambling and racketeering activities, primarily in the Pittsburgh area, alongside his brother Gabriel Mannarino. The FBI investigated their operations, which included gambling, loan sharking, and using businesses like Lloyds, Limited as fronts. Samuel's activities extended beyond Pittsburgh, as indicated by information received from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP). He was considered armed and dangerous. There was a report of him arriving in Pittsburgh from Miami and a potential threat against a contractor named Martin Murin. Increased law enforcement pressure, including IRS investigations, impacted their gambling operations.
significance: The provided documents do not explicitly link Samuel Mannarino to the JFK assassination. His significance lies in his involvement in organized crime and gambling activities during the period leading up to the assassination, making him a figure of interest in the broader context of organized crime investigations of the time.
